# 1. Measuring fund performance

Librerias
```{r,echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#install.packages("quantmod")
library(quantmod)
#install.packages("kableExtra")
library(kableExtra)
```


```{r,echo=FALSE}


tickers <- c("VSMPX","VFIAX","DODGX","SWPPX","RLBGX","FSGEX","VGHAX",
             "FPCIX","FTBFX","BBCPX","PTTRX","FKINX","CAIBX","ABALX",
             "AGTHX","GFFFX","AMECX","TRBCX","PIMIX","FBKWX")


portfolioPrices <- NULL
i <- 1
for (activos in tickers){
  portfolioPrices <- cbind(portfolioPrices, 
                           getSymbols.yahoo(Symbols =activos,index.class  = 'Date',from ="2017-05-01",
                                            to="2022-03-02",periodicity = "monthly",auto.assign = FALSE)[,6])
  i <- i + 1
}

```

```{r}
rentaibilidad <-monthlyReturn(portfolioPrices,leading = FALSE)
```

```{r}
n <- length(tickers)
for (i in n){
  rentaibilidad <-monthlyReturn(portfolioPrices[i+1],leading = FALSE)
}
```




```{r}
kable(portfolioPrices)
```
